Game Rewind | U of L outlasts IU at MSG

Game Rewind | U of L outlasts IU at MSG

Jonathan Lintner, jlintner@courier-journal.com 11:55 p.m. EST December 9, 2014

Indiana's James Blackmon Jr. (1) drives past Louisville's Montrezl Harrell (24) during the first half of an NCAA college basketball game Tuesday, Dec. 9, 2014, in New York. (AP Photo/Frank Franklin II)(Photo: Frank Franklin II, AP)

2 CONNECT 21 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Refresh regularly (or click here) throughout Tuesday's University of Louisville-Indiana University basketball game, the nightcap to the Jimmy V. Classic in Madison Square Garden.

Final: U of L 94, Indiana 74.

Terry Rozier finished with 26 points, Chris Jones had 24 and Montrezl Harrell 21 as the Cards' reserves got on the floor late in The Garden.

From New York City, see U of L beat writer Jeff Greer's quick analysis from the game (cjky.it/1shfVWA) and columnist Adam Himmelsbach writing a bit of what we learned (cjky.it/1weGG1J).

Full stats: http://bit.ly/1sbgcQt

This is the best I have seen Wayne Blackshear play since AAU ball. Louisville also a different team when Terry Rozier knocking down 3s.

— Jeff Goodman (@GoodmanESPN) December 10, 2014

I am not talking about Blackshear shooting. Talking about all-around game. Moving so much better. Passing, guarding, rebounding.

— Jeff Goodman (@GoodmanESPN) December 10, 2014

1:37, 2H: Hang in for final stats. Right now, Terry Rozier is working on a career-high 26 points as U of L leads IU 89-72.

2:35, 2H: It was an unfortunate stretch for IU, as Terry Rozier hit his fifth 3-pointer and the Hoosiers turned it over at the other end. But then James Blackmon secured a steal and ran away for a dunk. Tom Crean immediately called timeout, his team down 83-70, to reset the game.

3:55, 2H: And that could be the dagger. Anas Mahmoud hit a cutting Wayne Blackshear, who then passed off to Montrezl Harrell on the block. You know hot it ended. U of L 80, IU 68. Oh, and the dunk -- Harrell's seventh of the game -- tied a Cards single-game record set by Pervis Ellison.

5:56, 2H: Ball game? Not quite. After Terry Rozier gave U of L it's largest lead of the night, James Blackmon Jr. soared for a dunk on the other end. The Cards lead 76-64.

ICYMI: Here is the dunk from James Blackmon that everyone is talking about. http://t.co/HjMv3lRFe4

— IndianaMBB (@IndianaMBB) December 10, 2014

7:19, 2H: Again, free throws could decide this one. Wayne Blackshear will have another two out of the under-eight timeout with a shot at giving U of L a 13-point lead. The Cards are 3 of 12 from the free throw line.

Cards bench up and clapping and fist-pumping heading into this timeout. They can tell IU is on the ropes. 71-60.

— Adam Himmelsbach (@AdamHimmelsbach) December 10, 2014

8 minutes left in the 2nd half...when teams that try to run with Louisville die a slow and painful death.

— Adam Lefkoe (@AdamLefkoe) December 10, 2014

8:22, 2H: Anas Mahmoud nabbed U of L's 27th offensive rebound of the night and hurled it back at the basket, hitting the bucket and getting the foul. Of course, the Cards missed the free throw. But Terry Rozier got another offensive board and hit a quick layup for a 4-point swing. The Cards lead 71-60, again pulling away from IU.

10:38, 2H: A trip up the court after Terry Rozier settled for a distant, missed 3-pointer, Rick Pitino has called for a timeout to set something up. The Cards' biggest struggle tonight, other than basic halfcourt offense, has come at the free throw line, where they're 3 of 11. That's 27 percent.

11:34, 2H: Past 11:10 p.m. on the east coast, all eyes are on U of L and IU. The Cards lead 64-58 to the under-12 timeout, out of which Terry Rozier will have free throws after weathering a strong foul and shot to the face.

Chris Jones and Montrezl Harrell have 18 points apiece to pace U of L. Leading IU is James Blackmon Jr. with 12, though nine Hoosiers have scored.

Montrezl Harrell is officially the new All-Time Dunk Leader in Louisville Basketball history! #L1C4pic.twitter.com/XeDNHjJqCW

— Nick Stover (@ULFlyingCard) December 10, 2014

12:45, 2H: Montrezl Harrell is on another level, and he just became U of L's all-time dunks leader with 163 overall and six tonight. The Cards lead 62-56.

14:30, 2H: A Terry Rozier wing 3-pointer has U of L on a 10-0 run over two minutes, started when IU took its first lead of the half.

15:55, 2H: The IU lead was short-lived. Before the under-16 timeout, Chris Jones hit a 3-pointer to move U of L ahead 53-52. At the other end, the Hoosiers' Troy Williams turned it over to the Cards.

CJ3... so clutch.

— Louie the Cardinal (@LouietheCard) December 10, 2014

Chris Jones with a big-time corner 3. He and Montrezl Harrell both have 14 points. Jones 2 of 4 from long range tonight after 2 of 4 vs. FIU

— Jeff Greer (@jeffgreer_cj) December 10, 2014

16:23, 2H: Hanner Mosquera-Perea just charged into Mangok Mathiang for his third foul and is headed to the bench. Still, IU, which is 8 of 11 on 3-pointers tonight, leads 52-50. The Cards' best offense -- as Dick Vitale pointed out -- is a missed shot, Montrezl Harrell rebound and putback.

18:00, 2H: On a James Blackmon Jr. jumper, IU has its first lead at 47-46 since it was 9-6 in the first half. The Hoosiers are on a 6-0 run out of the locker room.

18:36, 2H: IU's Hanner Mosquera-Perea opened with another bucket -- he has dominated Chinanu Onuaku -- and James Blackmon Jr. added a layup, pulling the Hoosiers to within a point of U of L, 46-45. Timeout, Cards.

20:00, 2H: Tom Crean went six deep into his bench during the first half tonight. He has starters back out to open the second half, as does Rick Pitino. U of L's backcourt tandem of Chris Jones and Terry Rozier played essentially the entire first half, spelled just a bit by Anton Gill.

ESPN's Andy Katz reported from an interview with Pitino that the Cards coach is counting on conditioning to factor.

Quite a speech by Dick Vitale. Passionate and powerful. Begging people to go to http://t.co/YNiDubtZHt and give for cancer research.

— Steve Greenberg (@SLGreenberg) December 10, 2014

Halftime: U of L 46, IU 41.

Chris Jones helped the Cards into the half, first by stifling the IU run with a corner jump and then by drawing a foul near the buzzer. Jones didn't hit either free throw, though.

The Hoosiers closed the first half at MSG on a 10-2 run.

"We just need to calm down a little bit," IU coach Tom Crean said. "...The bottom line is, when we panic against their press, that's what they want us to do."

Full stats: http://bit.ly/1sbgcQt

Louisville really close to its season averages so far tonight: 42.6% from the field, 28.6% from 3. But 14 O-rebs and 13 IU TOs to offset.

— Jeff Greer (@jeffgreer_cj) December 10, 2014

Russ Smith Sr. is here at Madison Square Garden, cheering on the Cards.

— Adam Himmelsbach (@AdamHimmelsbach) December 10, 2014

1:00, 1H: Nick Zeisloft is on the court with two fouls and performing for IU, which is 7 of 10 from 3-point range. The Illinois State transfer hit from beyond the arc on back to back trips up the court, and James Blackmon Jr. hit a layup to make it 44-40. It was a quick 9-0 run.

This game is reminiscent of Kentucky-Indiana in the 2012 Sweet 16. Breakneck pace. Man, that was such a fun game.

— Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) December 10, 2014

3:27, 1H: One bit of bad news for U of L -- Montrezl Harrell picked up a second foul heading to the under-four timeout. Other than that, the Cards are cruising at MSG, ahead 44-31 behind 12 points from Harrell, 10 from Terry Rozier and some significant help off the bench from Mangok Mathiang.

Hoosiers aren't the first time to struggle with the #Cards pressure. The list is long but distinguished.

— UofL Pep Band (@UofLBand) December 10, 2014

4:35, 1H: Mangok Mathiang is on fire right now, already with 6 points, 2 blocks and a rebound. Add yet another Montrezl Harrell putback slam, and it's an IU timeout, the Cards ahead 42-31. U of L's also out-rebounding the Hoosiers by nine.

5:25, 1H: Platoon alert? Tom Crean just subbed all five of his players.

5:45, 1H: An acrobatic Chris Jones layup has U of L back ahead 7 at 38-31. The Cards are getting some surprising contributions from Mangok Mathiang, who has been slowed lately with a sore ankle. Mathiang quickly tallied 4 points and a rebound.

Indiana has played well offensively, but Hoosiers are a few poor possessions away from a double digit halftime deficit. #iubb

— Alex Bozich (@insidethehall) December 10, 2014

7:32, 1H: Montrezl Harrell has 10 points now, 8 of them on dunks, as the Cards lead 32-29 at the under-eight timeout. The All-American attempted a 3-pointer as well but missed, extending his streak of games without connecting from beyond the arc back to the Minnesota opener.

IU meanwhile has spread around its scoring among seven players, led by 8 Hanner Mosquera-Perea points. But he has two fouls, as does Nick Zeisloft.

The check we are presenting at the half. pic.twitter.com/ifqrIZA1mK

— Fred Cowgill WLKY (@FredCowgillWLKY) December 10, 2014

8:26, 1H: Montrezl Harrell can dunk all he wants, but they won't mean a thing if the Cards give up 4-point plays. Max Hoetzel had a chance at one -- he missed the free throw after hitting a corner 3-pointer and absorbing a Wayne Blackshear foul -- that has IU within a point, 30-29.

10:19, 1H: Rick Pitino loves deflections, just not the last one from Wayne Blackshear. He tipped a pass out of U of L's 2-3 zone straight into the hands of IU's Nick Zeisloft, who hit a 3-pointer. Pitino called a timeout, still ahead 23-21. Whereas U of L is 9 of 24 and getting plenty of second chances, IU has made 9 of its first 14 attempts.

Louisville should play every game in the garden lol... #somethingaboutthemlights

— Peyton Siva Jr (@PeypeySiva3) December 10, 2014

11:15, 1H: Jaylen Johnson hit 1 of 2 free throws to cap a 7-0 U of L run. At the other end, Troy Williams answered by flying in for a two-handed jam, pulling the Hoosiers to within 23-18.

11:37, 1H: Welcome to college basketball, Jaylen Johnson. He's headed to the free throw line after the under-12 timeout and a possession in which U of L hauled in four offensive rebounds. Ahead 22-16, the Cards have 13 total rebounds and 10 of them on the offensive end.

Three things you can't do against Louisville: Turn it over, give up offensive rebounds, put them on the line. Indiana doing all three.

— Jeff Greer (@jeffgreer_cj) December 10, 2014

12:12, 1H: Montrezl Harrell's motor is running. He scored back-to-back buckets on a soaring dunk, steal out of the press and then a layup. Guy's fired up, and it's a timeout IU. The Cards lead 22-16.

13:20, 1H: With 8 early points, the last of them on a hook shot, IU's Hanner Mosquera Perea has already eclipsed his scoring average per game. His length is causing U of L problems under the basket. It's 16-16 after Terry Rozier missed a pair of free throws. He has 7 points to lead the Cards.

15:14, 1H: "Are you serious?!" yelled Dick Vitale. Montrezl Harrell's first monster dunk of the game was called off for an offensive foul right out of the under-16 timeout.

See it here: https://vine.co/v/Or0Xi0geF9V

15:23, 1H: A quick-paced game sends U of L to the first media timeout ahead 11-9, up on a coast-to-coast layup by Terry Rozier. Interesting early is Rick Pitino bringing Anas Mahmoud in for starting big man Chinanu Onuaku, who doesn't have a foul but struggled to contain IU's Hanner Mosquera-Perea.

Anas Mahmoud = Scrawny Arms Rob Lowe.

— Pat Forde (@YahooForde) December 10, 2014

16:32, 1H: Anas Mahmoud was quick off the bench for U of L and just made his first gaffe, goaltending an offensive board on a shot that appeared as if it was going down anyway.

17:10, 1H: Trading 3-pointers, a triple by Wayne Blackshear tied this one at 9-9 of a game with few whistles early. Good basketball. Blackshear has 6 points for the Cards.

17:48, 1H: The Hoosiers' Hanner Mosquera-Perea is filling up the stat sheet early. He has 4 points and a block as IU leads 6-3.

Vegas spread: Louisville by 12. KenPom algorithm: Louisville by 11. http://t.co/p2Wc6Op82A: Louisville by 6.

— Jeff Greer (@jeffgreer_cj) December 10, 2014

20:00, 1H: There aren't any surprises expected in the starting lineups tonight. Tipoff is coming soon...

Said Rick Pitino pregame: "This is a great passing team -- great shooting team...we're going to have to space our defense and try to turn them over."

A busy night at The World's Most Famous Arena. #JimmyVClassicpic.twitter.com/jWkPZyWHPU

— NCAA March Madness (@marchmadness) December 10, 2014

PREGAME: The listed tipoff time for U of L-IU is 9 p.m., but more realistically, we're looking at around 9:35 or 9:40 p.m. now that Villanova-Illinois has finished up in New York.

Even if you're tuning into ESPN, stick around on here for live stats, beat writer Jeff Greer's insights from The Garden, a look at what national experts are saying about the game and quick video of all the top plays.

Good evening from Madison Square Garden. Villanova/Illinois now, Louisville/Indiana later. pic.twitter.com/PO82CLWAmB

— Adam Himmelsbach (@AdamHimmelsbach) December 10, 2014

Seems like there are considerably more Indiana fans here than UL fans. Pitino predicted that.

— Adam Himmelsbach (@AdamHimmelsbach) December 10, 2014

Until then, a few notes of interest and some pregame reading...

Making the rounds on social media Tuesday was college basketball expert Fran Fraschilla's in-depth breakdown of how U of L's offense works. "One constant through the years for Pitino, regardless of defensive scheme, is maniacal ball pressure," he wrote to start the ESPN Insider piece. Check it out. (http://es.pn/1sgCOtl)

U of L-IU hasn't drawn the same scope of national attention as, for instance, the Cards' game last week against Ohio State. But Seth Davis hasn't hesitated to offer his prediction, first in a Sports Illustrated article and again on Twitter Tuesday evening when he wrote, "I've already called IU over Louisville. Book it." (http://bit.ly/1yxsjsG)

We have plenty of coverage at The Courier-Journal, too. See a game preview (http://cjky.it/1zkoVjD), story lines (http://cjky.it/1yIvKvC), five questions with Indianapolis Star writer Zach Osterman (http://cjky.it/1D3TSwJ) and more answers with Greer for The Star (http://indy.st/1336lAV). Plus, make your own prediction before tipoff (http://cjky.it/1qjStfQ).

And one other thing, to make you feel a bit old. This is U of L's first Jimmy V. Classic appearance since a 2006 loss to Arizona at The Garden that marked Derrick Caracter's first minutes for the Cardinals. And in 2003 -- that last U of L-IU game that was pre-empted on CBS by coverage of the Space Shuttle Columbia's crash -- the Cardinals' starters were Reece Gaines, Taquan Dean, Erik Brown, Ellis Myles and Marvin Stone.

UofL is fine when Rozier+Jones are both in or both out. But with just one, they're struggling: #L1C4pic.twitter.com/TE48QV6POg

— Cards & Cats Stats (@CardsCatsStats) December 10, 2014

Projected U of L Starters

G Chris Jones

G Terry Rozier

F Wayne Blackshear

F Montrezl Harrell

C Chinanu Onuaku

Projected IU Starters

G Yogi Ferrell

G Robert Johnson

G James Blackmon Jr.

F Troy Williams

F Hanner Mosquera-Perea
